comments.body: What about the full keyboard controls? With full keyboard controls, C is used to open the inventory. For full keyboard controls, it should be N. Anyways, I like the idea. Upvoted.
What if you have optifine zoom the zoom feature is pressed by c and if this gets added to bedrock phone players will be dissapointed cause phones dont have a keyboard

Apparently they were going to give it a keybind, but decided against it because ‚Äúplayers should be creative to use it‚Äù or something like that. Really makes no sense and isn‚Äôt really fair if they don‚Äôt just have an unsaid real reason of ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt think crawling really fits the game,‚Äù so let‚Äôs make our voices heard!

@XNygelTernsX They could give it a different key then, and of course it would have a different button for other controls. You can also configure what to press in the controls menu, including what to press for Optifine‚Äôs zoom.

It really doesn't make sense to allow crawling, but only if the player uses a trapdoor or something like that... It's a... bizarre... design decision. Please just simply add the ability to crawl on command? As it stands now, crawling is a nice function that's buried behind the clumsiest of interfaces.

This is a very good idea.

It would be good for mapmakers, so they dont have to break immersion if they want the player to crawl. Or if you wanted to sneak into your friends base.

I really like this idea and maybe they could add a sitting button and a laying down button. I would like to see three more keys come to use in these ways. I hope they add this because this would make gameplay more fun. And don't forget the roleplayers would love this.

Yes! Finally an easy way to fit into 1 block gaps.

So we choose when to:

  • Elytra glide
  • Swim fast
  • crawl

It might be possible to use ctrl+up for elytra/swimming and ctrl+shift+up for crawling. (rather than having a dedicated key)
Or, it could be like how you double tap W to sprint and you have to double tap shift or whatever else your crouch button is, because c is already used for loading hotbars in creative mode.
this is interesting but wouldn't console be left out on this
Yeah this makes a lot of sense to me

i agree. if i could play my pc survival on my phone that would be amazing

And for single player, make this free. I would like to play my world on my Switch and PC. Even if it uses a third party service for sync, like Dropbox or Onedrive.

Paying $8 a month for realms for just single player use is not a good solution.

Agreed. A native system for choosing the save folder would be great.

I used to have a jerry-rigged system that allowed Minecraft Bedrock Edition to save its data to my OneDrive.

 

Read More:

I used to be able to trick the WindowsApps system into allowing Read/Write access to my OneDrive folder. But in 2018, after two years of using and maintaining that jerry-rigged system, I gave up on it because the Windows Apps permissions became more and more strict.

My jerry-rigged system was set up so my worlds and resource packs would sync via OneDrive to my desktop, laptop, and even to my phone. Loading and saving PC saves on my phone would corrupt the world seed due to version differences, but I didn't mind at the time.

Fast-forward to 2020. Things are going okay with local-only saves...until Minecraft Bedrock's .NET Native Runtime dependency just disappeared after a Windows update. After investigating over the course of two weeks, I discovered that the app's local data folder was empty aside from the UWP settings files.

All of my saves from 2015 to 2020 were gone. Including the one that I played consistently throughout that time.

The only backup I have is from 2018, when my cloud save system still worked.

I tried using several file recovery utilities to find the worlds' files, but the few files that were recoverable were from template worlds and downloaded addons. Even if I was able to find the world files, normal file recovery tools are unable to recover encrypted files.

I just lost all of my sons worlds on windows 10 edition because I falsely thought it was backing it up to the cloud like it does on xbox. This needs to be instituted. Also we have lots of devices and my son has to use specific ones to be able to play in different worlds. Not convenient when I want my PC and so does he.
There is an addon for this on MCPE DL.
Yes pls i need this

Omg! Yes! Yes! Yes! A 1000x yes! With night mode enabled, it will be a massive relief for my eyes, in terms of significantly reduced eyestrain and I wouldn't have to turn down my TV brightness! Adding this feature should be a no-brainer.

Agreed-- it's a shame right now that the Vivecraft mod vastly outstrips the official release in customization of controls, being able to use the motion controllers, custom button maps and let me tell you being able to swing a sword to fight and pull back a bow to shoot is a game-changer regarding the combat (bow needs work in vivecraft, though). 

I also wanna say getting Minecraft working on VR was also a pain, as there isn't any sort of warning that Java Edition doesn't count as an "owned" account even though it's a pc version. I ended up having to purchase the game twice (which ended up good since I now get to play with the RTX beta) and had to consult Google for troubleshooting/error codes a bit more often than I'd like for a Microsoft-backed game.

Villagers should have a small radius (10 blocks or less) to search for profession blocks. That will increase performance (due to less block to test), and reduce or eliminate this problem.

In my world i cure a zombie villager like +50 block away from my base and he took one of the barrel of my storage, i basically destroy half of my storage so he can take another block.

Another thing they should do is villagers can only take profession block they access (pathfinding), if they can't, just search for another. But i don't if this will break current iron farms.

sorry for my my english, it isn't my native language.

You can use decorative profession blocks, as you change a villager's profession (optional), trade with them, and they'll never change their profession. You can now use decorative profession blocks with the villager.

The big difficulty in change the behavior of blocks is  all blocks are craft in the same way (in the crafting table, stone cutter and so on). There is no diference between a "decorative" block and functional block. 

A way to do it,  (with the blocks we  have today) is rename it. But we use a lot of blocks and it will be tedious to do it and repetitive as well. 

The "turn off" option definitely is another way to do it. But keeps the problem that, have to be set block by block.

Another solution is change the process of how these blocks are made of. i.e. Another "crafting table" this will set a parameter to make it invisible to the villagers. But we overstep another problem Mojang wants to avoid. Duplicate blocks with same function. It's not intuitive for the gamer, MInecraft is treat as "Simple Game" that anyone can play.

The radius of villagers' detection must to be "big" because of villages' size. Maybe if the type of detection change, could solve the issue, but restrict where these blocks can be placed to assign professions. An example of detection type for the villager is have a block of air above profession block for example.

In short story, the change does not coming to the block itself, but to the villagers and how they find the blocks.
Villagers should work like they do in java, would make things so easy!

It's possible to enable POI blocking without implementing a new UI or mechanic. If a POI is renamed in an anvil (including beds, workstations, and bells) villagers should skip it when searching for POIs. This would allow players to use them as decoration without messing up their villager farms and would use existing in-game mechanics.
Please fix this so we can use all these blocks to build with!!
I think the best option is to just make it so that they have to be able to pathfind to a POI in order to link with it.

Would be nice to keep the current default behavior as is, but with an additional option to 'entice' a specific villager to a specific workstation. Maybe similar mechanic as attaching a leash to a creature. But instead of between a creature and a fence pole, between a villager and a workstation. It's OK to hide the leash, or only show as a ghost/transparant leash when the player is very close by. Only 1 additional item needed in game, and without it, the behavior as it is currently will stay.

Another way to link would be similar to the name tagging or compass-to-lodestone linking. When building a workstation, it has 1 tag in its inventory that can be used to assign a villager, which will then be force-linked until the station is broken. The station produces only 1 tag when placed. If you need another tag, the previous tag becomes invalid and when placed again a new tag is created.

Both ways solve the enormous tediousness with linking, without changing the default behavior for the folk that don't want to meddle with it.

Put a block under, the solution should be to put a specific type of block under the same way we do with note blocks, I suggest a slab, a "full" slab block, stairs, or some other type of half-block (Maybe even light-blocks like glowstone or the water one) to turn off the job. I see these blocks as things you could easily camouflage in your decoration and that wouldn't affect farms or villages, and please don't make change de radius, that would destroy some farms and decorative villages.

100% with this suggestion. It's almost an essential implementation, given the amount of players using job blocks for decoration; especially the barrell - the amount of Fishermen walking around my base while I set up new trades is ridiculous. üòÇ
Renaming it and not allow villagers to link to renamed workstations would be a simple and,practical solution

I agree with some of the others here; it would be great if renaming a job block to anything other than the original name caused villagers not to use it. I get so annoyed by all these fishermen and shepherds wandering around.

I agree STRONGLY that this feature is needed.  SO many people want to use them as decorations without changing village behavior.

I like the idea that was suggested of having the jobsite's behavior change depending on what block is under it, like noteblocks.
A simple UI method, a non-functional variant of the block, or any of the several other suggestions would be great.  But we need SOMETHING.

It is so huge shame! Before kids have played Monicraft splitscreen online with their friends on their Wii U and PS4, I bought 3 Nintendo Switch for my kids but now we can't  play online in spliscreen with their friends who does not have nintendo switch, shame on developers and Nintendo!

Other thing, if you run Minecraft on the console that isn't registered as main console you can't  play Spliscreen online at all even if all of accounts has online subscription it just unavailable to choose! WTF!?! So sad so mad!

Found a workaround: Create "dummy" Nintendo accounts for each guest player (so up to 4 accounts), and add them all to a family Nintendo Switch Online plan. I've done so, and named the accounts Mario, Luigi, Yoshi, and Toad, and use them whenever I want to play split-screen with guests.
They want you to buy the family plan instead of the regular is mybguess

I already have a family group with 8 family members, each with their own Switch. So if a friend wanted to join an online game with me and/or my siblings, we're out of luck? Just because we are at our max amount of family members? This is the only game on switch I can think of that doesn't allow for local/online multiplayer combined.

Is this because Microsoft's online subscription services work similar to this? Having each account you want to use for online play have a online subscription attached to it? This approach does not really work on Switch since a Switch is mostly tied to just one individual and thus has mostly just one account per Switch (in the case of my family at least), as opposed by a home console which probably has all those accounts centralised on one console and thus allows for easy combined local/online play.

It's a damn shame how many times Minecraft has disappointed me, because it seems so much fun but there's these little bugs and things that keep that fun at a distance.
Agree but I think that Nintendo is the one that disabled it
I hope Minecraft does something about this. Nintendo shouldn‚Äôt be so greedy.

Why does Minecraft need this? You could just dig a hole in the ground and put all your junk in some chests. Or throw it in lava. Or just toss it out and wait for it to despawn. There are many ways to deal with this problem, so I don't see how your idea adds anything of value.

Also, I'm afraid people will accidentally move valuable tools to their trash all the time with this feature. I wouldn't want that to happen.
This exists in the the creative inventory so it's just a matter of copy and paste, as well as extending the background. This is more of a user interface topic.

even in survival and creative, as much as it is easy to delete in creative, just lava, in survival this is harder to do, and just dragging and dropping in the trash would be simpler, its a nice idea, even though it was already in Java, it wouldn't hurt for Bedrock to use this as well...

I see now bad coming from this feature other than an accidental press of whatever key or button is pressed. But if you mirror what Terraia does it just holds the item until the next one is thrown away. Yes, you already can throw stuff in a hole or lava, or some restone contraption, but why not let everyone have the option to do that than just saying "NO", more options the better in my book.
WONT ADD IT!!!!!
Hgecrrcv
The concept of a "trash can" does not really fit to survival. You can't just make an item disappear without using it up.
Personally why this wasn't already implemented when it already was a feature (in creative) is beyond me and if implemented would benefit greatly.

I think this is a brilliant idea! You have no idea how much simpler it would be for me to delete things this way rather than placing lava down throwing a bunch of items into it and then picking the lava up again which is kind of a hassle.

While the feature works nicely in Terraria, I'm not sure it would transfer well in survival Minecraft. In Terraria, items don't despawn or burn in lava, so the trash can is really the only way to dispose of stuff. Terraria also has a safety feature where you can favorite items to keep them locked into your inventory. Terraria items are also organized into tiers, with the gray tier being objectively worthless.

Minecraft, for starters, doesn't have the tier system. No item is truly worthless. Even rotten flesh can be traded with villagers. Of course, sometimes you still want to get rid of items. This much is true. But it would give the added risk, as MacchuPicchu notes, of accidentally throwing out valuable items. (In creative mode, of course, you could just bring it right back, so it makes more sense to have it there.) And unlike Terraria, we can just throw stuff at a cactus.

This doesn't mean that your idea is just total garbage (pun intended), but I think it definitely needs some tweaking. I do agree that when I'm mining, sometimes I don't want to be picking up every single item on the ground just to toss it down and pick it up again. So either an additional "safety" feature like Terraria has, that doesn't let you throw certain items out, or else maybe it doesn't really delete the item, but rather, throws it on the ground and doesn't let you pick it up again for a certain amount of time. Stuff despawns after five minutes, I believe, so anything that you "delete" could be thrown on the ground and marked that you can't pick it up for, say, three minutes. Still kind of a mess, so maybe it turns invisible too? But it would be a built-in safety feature to keep your diamonds safe.
Yes but only for creative
What a good idea I play Terraria and the trash can is a really good feature!!!

Hey all. To stop the vibration simply slide your fingers down from the top of your screen and mute the phone which stops all sounds and vibrations. Yous are very welcome in advance
So nice
can someone please fix this!!!!! all vibration on the phone is off and still having the issue

Get quickedit from playstore. Open it and press 3 lines in top left corner select internal storage and then find folder called games go in this and find com.mojang folder go in that and find minecraftpe folder. Go in this folder and click on options.txt. scroll down until you find and feedback_vibration and if any have the number 1 next to them press on the line you want to edit and change all the 1s that are feedback_vibratin to 0s then save and exit now vibration should be off. Hope it works for you all

Your dream half- came true

Just saw the BLM one today. Let's leave the political/social commentaries out of games, please. Some games involve in-universe political discussions and plotlines, but very few break the fourth wall and discuss current real-life politics (for good reason).
I'm honestly surprised this post was allowed through. Thanks, Mojang. I also appreciate the (two) comments this thread received. It's good to know I'm not entirely alone in my observations.

I totally agree with everyone's post about the BLM quip at the start of the game.

By the way....

Rule #1-LEAVE the politics out of a game such as this there is no room for it.

Rule #2-LEAVE the politics out of a game such as this there is no room for it.

Rule #3- *ALL LIVES MATTER!* 

I am neither a bigot or racist at all and believe everyone needs to be treated equally regardless of colour, community status or wealth. It does NOT matter what colour I am or, if I am a president/ CEO in a company or a billionaire. It does NOT make me better than the person next to me who isn't any of these things...   

It won't mean much to the developers (and makes me look like tantrum chucker) but I will forego playing this game today due to the politically incorrect quip.

"Covfefe" was funny, and everyone got it.

But these new messages crossed a line real fast. Mojang, your job is to make an interesting and entertaining game. Your tautological political statements aren't nearly as important as you think, and they won't fill the void you have inside.

Agreed, this needs to stay out of Minecraft. It's off-putting and potentially alienating to players who aren't woke or don't agree with the left. The nation's as polarized as it's been since the war between the states, and the last thing I want to see is real world politics brought up while I'm playing a block game.
Unfortunately there's been no action taken on this (I saw another statement recently). Regardless, I'm happy to see the amount of support this thread got. Thank you.
Real-world politics have no place in Minecraft, and shouldn't be influenced. Express them outside of the franchise.

New splash texts on the menu screen now reference gender identity including "Contains infinite genders!" which goes against my beliefs. Can Mojang please explain to me why my favorite game is becoming ideologically oriented? 

It would be less divisive if you didn‚Äôt say anything at all.
Just saw "Educate your friends on anti-racism!". Mojang, please stop. All I want is a game about blocks.

This is the second time my son has lost worlds on xbox.  Before it was an xbox tech that had me delete things and for some reason it wasn't syncing and she should have checked prior.  Now this time my sons xbox died, but we have 2 and he's played on the other xbox but not as frequent ... he can't find many of his worlds and his most important world says it is corrupted.  I do not understand how every other game we own, syncs to the cloud just fine except for Minecraft.  What is the deal and what can you do to fix this?  This is a serious issue.  Who wants to play a game that at any time can just be lost???  My 8 year old son is who.  And I, as his mother, have to try to fix this issue.  PLEASE figure out why xbox syncing does not seem to work properly with Minecraft and ONLY Minecraft.

This would also be helpful for when someone's data has to be wiped from a device. I've repeatedly had issues with my laptop, and they always erase my data when we send it in for repair, and on multiple occasions I've had months, even years worth of effort put into Minecraft worlds go down the drain, and it seems like such a simple concept that would save so many people from so much heartbreak.

You are not the only one. I came here to discuss the same.

It‚Äôs not even an issue of ‚Äúgetting used to‚Äù the Bedrock control scheme, it‚Äôs that the older Nintendo Switch edition ‚Äúfelt better‚Äù.

Control can be a subjective thing in video games, but generally we all agree when a developer nails it, and controls ‚Äúfeel good‚Äù. I can tell you that the controls for the Bedrock version of Minecraft on the Nintendo Switch are a significant step in the wrong direction, and would ask that the current Minecraft developers play the old Nintendo Switch version (which was outsourced by the way) for a day or two, then come back to their own version, and it will be quite clear how clunky Bedrock actually is.

I‚Äôm sure they where so concerned about getting it working at all, that these concerns where left by the wayside. (Remember the better-together update was quite late on Switch). However, now that it‚Äôs been functional for some time, we need to speak up. It‚Äôs the only way we‚Äôll get this corrected.

Thanks for your consideration team.

To add to what OP said, you can currently disable this feature by turning Fancy Graphics off.
However I enjoy every fancy graphic except this one, would be nice for vignettes of all types to be their own toggle option (with the exception of the pumpkin mask overlay). I'd like to be able to disable everything that borders my screen as I also find these effects extremely visually distracting and detrimental to gameplay.
I also causes a bit of eye strain too

I've started to realize the vignette effects in Minecraft give me a constant sense of claustrophobia. Even when out in the open in full daylight.

Pressing F1 to hide the HUD also makes the vignette go away, instantly removing the primary source of my claustrophobia feeling.

While the vignettes are removable via custom resource packs it would be nice if this was an accessibility option since updates frequently break old resource packs.

Adding in my 2 cents and agreeing with what's been said here; I don't typically find myself affected by eyestrain/similar very frequently, but I have noticed that the caving vignette contributes/causes this a lot, and I often can't spend much time underground as I'll begin to get eyestrain and headaches from it‚Äîwhich is not ideal when caving and mining is typically my favorite thing in Java, where I don't have as much of an issue (if any) as in Bedrock.

I think it's also very straining because it often disappears while in other menus (inventories, crafting, etc) and then reappears upon exiting.

Would love to see this as an individually toggleable option, particularly for accessibility purposes, if not to just have it be removed entirely, or made to be less obstructive/noticable.

+1, currently looking for any option to remove this visual as it causes the player to either play with fast gfx enabled or deal with having a distracting border on their screen.. or simply never build their home deep down.
Yes this option need to really be a toggle feature as I feel a mix of eye strain and sea sick
